definition: to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss

sentences.english: I must make amends for my fault.
He insisted that I (should) apologize to her.
sentences.chinese: 他堅持我應該向她賠罪。

sentences.english: Then said they, What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return to him?
sentences.chinese: 非利士人說，應當用什麼獻爲賠罪的禮物呢。

sentences.english: She would have done anything to make amends.
He made amends for his rudeness by giving her some flowers.
sentences.chinese: 他送給她一些花，爲他自己的魯莽賠罪。

sentences.english: Be careful of what you say or you'll have to eat humble pie .
sentences.chinese: 說話當心點，否則你就得道歉賠罪。

definition: to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
ashamed and unable to show one's face
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
